title: The Comparison Page
subtitle: Comparing cryptocurrency market prices across exchanges
body: When using InterTrader, if you're not [searching for profitable trades](/user-guide/finding-profitable-cryptocurrency-pairs/ "Finding profitable cryptocurrency pairs: search and analysis") , a lot of your time will be spent on the comparison page, where you can see: * Prices of a cryptocurrency pair across multiple exchanges * Potential profit * Orderbooks from the exchanges where the coin is listed ## Price chart The prominent bar chart on the comparison page provides a quick overview of the buy and sell price across all the exchanges for which InterTrader has coin pair data. ![Price comparison chart](/gin-data/images/1527802167227-compare-crypto-chart.png "Price comparison chart") ## Price analysis Tapping Bitcoin icon in the nav bar displays the price analysis summary for the coin pair. This is the buy/sell price information described in the [search and analysis guide](/user-guide/finding-profitable-cryptocurrency-pairs/#what-it-all-means "Finding profitable cryptocurrency pairs"). If there is potential profit to be earned, it is displayed here. ![Price analysis](/gin-data/images/1527802334136-compare-crypto-analysis.png "Price analysis") ## Exchange details Below the bar chart are the numerical buy and sell prices for each exchange. You'll also find the coin name, where available, so you can more easily determine if the coins sharing the same ticker are being compared. > The quality of information returned from each exchange varies considerably. For this reason, the ticker symbol is the most reliable way to match and compare coins â€” but it isn't perfect. Make sure you verify that you're not trying to intertrade two different coins. ![Exchange price details](/gin-data/images/1527802183524-compare-crypto-details.png "Exchange price details") ## Orderbook Tap the list icon for each exchange to see their orderbooks. InterTrader returns the last five buy and sell orders so that you can more quickly determine if there is enough supply and demand to make a profitable trade. > *NOTE: Some exchanges don't provide a way to retrieve orderbook data, so the list icon will not appear.* ![Orderbook](/gin-data/images/1527803518235-compare-crypto-orderbook.png "Orderbook") ## Performing calculations For convenience there is a cost calculator available when viewing the exchange details or the orderbook. To open the calculator for a particular exchange: Tap and hold on one of the exchange details boxes and the calculator will open. The price will be pre-populated but is also editable. Use the *Buy/Sell* option to switch between the buy and sell price. Enter a quantity to find out what it would cost at the specified price. ![Exchange cost calculator](/gin-data/images/1528301264979-compare-crypto-details-calculator.png "Exchange cost calculator") To open the calculator for an orderbook order: Tap and hold one of the rows in the table and the calculator will open. The price, quantity and total will all be pre-populated, but only the price and quantity remain editable. ![Orderbook cost calculator](/gin-data/images/1528302041295-compare-crypto-orderbook-calculator.png "Orderbook cost calculator") > *NOTE: You can't change the *Buy/Sell* option on the orderbook.* ___ #### InterTrader user guides {{list type=page blog=0 match=/user-guide/}}
